tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=16, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Position: Principal Network Architect

Location: Houston, TX

Duration: 6 months

Rate: $ Open/Hour on W2

Need a resource who can go for In-Person interview and Remote work

Our client is looking for an Infrastructure architect (local to or willing to relocate to Houston, TX) with a specialization/background in networking to support ongoing and future projects.

This individual will work with a global team of Principal architects with various areas of specialization- Hosting, End User Compute, IAM, Unified Communications, etc.

This person will help to provide additional support for the Network Architecture segment.

1. Strong background across networking technologies (Cisco)- including 2-3+ years of creating and implementing successful network architecture designs/solving business problems in a large environment. *should be able to highlight and discuss successful creation and presentation of designs that resulted in successful implementations and impact to the business.

2. Ability to work across/support various project teams providing advisement and ensuring architectural standards are met.

3. Prior experience working in Oil/Gas or similar industry highly preferred. At minimum candidates need knowledge of OT versus IT, differences, standards/best practice on how to design in that type of environment.

4. Experience working in distributed teams ideally in a global enterprise (including multi-cultural teams and varied time zones). Strong communication skills and good interpersonal skills.

5. Nice to haves include knowledge of or certification for TOGAF. Cisco certifications professional level or above (Design certifications preference).

Job Description:

Reporting directly into the Manager, Infrastructure Architecture this role has responsibility for infrastructure strategy, reference architecture, roadmap, standards, integration points and identifying dependencies within existing systems and new systems across client's Technology Landscape.

Responsibilities include:

Working with key stakeholders across Technology to develop strategy and architecture for Enterprise Infrastructure and Architecture to support business outcomes.

This will include Hosting, End User Computing, Unified Communications, Identity & Access Management, and Network.

The individual will operate with the support and guidance of the broader Infrastructure Architecture team and will create strategy, reference architecture, roadmaps, and standards.

Technical Skills:

Knowledge and experience creating Infrastructure Strategy and Roadmaps Knowledge and experience creating Standards and Reference Architecture Knowledge and experience creating High Level Designs and Low Level Designs Knowledge and experience of Networking technologies including SD-WAN, MPLS, VRF, DMVPN, multicast, load balancing, switching and routing technologies.

Knowledge and experience of Network security constructs and capabilities including Layer 3 and Layer 7 firewalls, IPS, VPN, and Proxy.

Knowledge and experience of hosting technologies including:

Hyper-converged infrastructure, Converged Infrastructure, VMware virtualization, Windows Server OS, RHEL and CITRIX presentation services.

Knowledge and experience with supporting infrastructure service technologies including Active Directory, AzureAD, DNS, DHCP, NTP, file and printing services.

Knowledge and experience with both IT and OT control systems with respect to hosting and network infrastructure

Knowledge and experience unified communication, collaboration technologies and telecoms services including Cisco Video Conferencing, WebEx Meetings, WebEx Teams, Immersive, voice, and SIP.

Ability to construct complex bill of materials from a logical design to support a purchase requisition

Experience or knowledge with Digital Radio systems and the options associated with remote dispatch consoles

Understanding of middleware applications and how they may interact with other dependent systems (e.g. Understand what a multitier application is and how SQL high availability configuration would have reliance on an Active / Active datacentre configuration)

Knowledge and experience of implementing end user computing systems including Windows 10 desktop, SCCM, Office 365.

Experience with monitoring and management tools for infrastructure services including SolarWinds, Splunk, SCOM etc.

Soft skills:

Work in a local region capacity in a global organisation with the requirement for out of standard business hours phone calls and meetings Fluent in English. Spanish a plus.

Ability to negotiate with business acumen relating to technical issues and queries Excellent documentation skills.

Client will provide standard driven document templates and stencils.

Recommended to have experience working on a mine or petroleum site and working in adverse conditions.

Strong communication and interpersonal skills. The role will require interaction with a large number of stakeholders.

Excellent verbal skills including precise questioning and answering.

About You:

Minimum 10 years of experience in the IT industry. (resource industry experience favorable)Technical and Solution Architecture background essential.

Background in operating & supporting large-scale mission critical server, storage and network environments.

Wide exposure to different hardware, operating systems, and network platforms.

Excellent analytical skills.

Good understand of ITIL and related processes.

Process oriented service delivery mindset with a strong focus on continuous improvement.

Qualifications:

Bachelor Degree in Computer Science/Engineering or equivalent, ITIL v3, TOGAF 9, Professional level Cisco Certifications, Professional level Microsoft Certifications, Professional Level VMware Certifications.

Senior Software Developer - Full Stack

The Senior Software Developer - Full Stack will be part of a strong .Net development team, and will be responsible for both enhancing existing Web applications and developing new Web applications. The Senior Software Developer must work well in a team setting and have excellent organizational, prioritization, communication, and time management skills.


Description of Duties:

A full stack web and C# developer
Provide code review and support to junior members of the development team
Improve and build upon existing unit tests
Maintains and troubleshoots existing .Net Web applications
Architects, designs and develops applications as described by the requirements
Ensures that security is designed into all applications developed
Follows development lifecycle to ensure quality deliverables within specified timelines
Manages assigned tasks through to resolution
Investigates and develops skills in new technologies
Works closely with and performs other related duties as assigned or requested by his/her supervisor.
Comfortable working in a 100% remote environment

Required Skills and Knowledge:

8+ Years of professional experience in all stages of definition, design, implementation, testing, and deployment of web-based software solutions
Experience with Web API and ASP.NET Core/Standard
Experience with modern JavaScript frameworks/libraries like Angular.js, React.js, vue.js
Experience in C#, HTML5, JavaScript, CSS, and Microsoft T-SQL
Must be willing to work in Vue.js/Typescript
Familiarity with NoSQL storage like mongo dB or documented.
Familiarity with distributed/scalable systems hosted in any cloud provider.
Experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment.
Willingness to learn new technologies
Strong communication and collaboration skills (to both business and technical partners)
Experience with Agile methodologies as part of a scrum team
In-depth knowledge of web application architecture, design and development, and applications as scale
In-depth knowledge of object-oriented design principles

Not Required but a Plus:

SSO experience
Typescript experience
Unit testing Moq, Karma, Mocha

Outstanding benefits include health, dental, and vision insurance plans; life insurance and short-term|long-term disability programs; paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays.

items.content:
ColibriGroup | Software Engineer | REMOTE (USA / Mexico)

Colibri Group is a family of brands (McKissock, Elite, Advance Healthcare, Western Healthcare, Real Estate Express, Superior School of Real Estate, Allied Schools, The Institute for Luxury Home Marketing, XCEL Testing Solution, and Securities Training Corporation) that provide learning solutions for licensed professionals in over 20 fields, including real estate, property appraisal, engineering, nursing, social work, massage therapy and cosmetology. Our companies are taking mandated professional education to the next level as we produce tools, courses, and job aides that help customers achieve more in their days and their careers. We help professionals become licensed, stay licensed and gain the skills to perform at the top of their fields.

Essential Skillset: TypeScript, Angular 6+, Unit Testing (Jasmine/Karma), Experience consuming APIs. GitNice to have: Knowledge of relational databases and SQL .NET / C#

What Youâll Do: As a Software Engineer, youâll play a key role in building and testing new features and frameworks for supporting an ecosystem of common web applications used by many subsidiaries within the Colibri Group family of companies. Youâll work as a member of the technology team to collaborate with UX, product management, QA and other software engineers to define new features, estimate and implement them. Your main duties will start within the TypeScript/Angular framework, which will be consuming a .NET API, which you will have the opportunity to work on as well. In addition to creating tests with Jasmine/Karma and completing peer reviewed pull request into our production environment.

Responsibilities: We practice continuous delivery and work in an agile environment. You'll design and implement critical elements of architecture and application components for common offerings. The ideal applicant pays close attention to detail, is inquisitive, able to be self-directed while open to collaboration. We follow an unapologetic âno egoâ release process where fellow engineers input opinions and suggestions on the code you would like to release to production, thereby attempting to ensure the highest quality code is released. Youâll be working on a team that owns the code from development through release into production, for multiple applications, deploying a DevOps model of complete ownership.

A bit more about the position: The position will involve support of several of our web applications. Foremost among these would be the customer dashboard. Our dashboard is setup to serve our different subsidiary companies with the same set of code. It is angular, with a dash of ionic (which we have been slowly moving away from while staying committed to angular.) The dashboard is actively developed with 11,000 commits over the last two years. As a developer on the membership/mobile team we are concentrating on improving our customers membership experience by adding and improving features to the dashboard. Other applications you will have the opportunity to interact with are a c#.net api application, a .net student course runner application as well as older .net internal applications.

We run in an agile pattern with two week sprints, story point estimating, daily zoom standups, and sprint retrospectives. Our sprint planning meetings typical have developers discussing what the highest priority is with direction from the product owner and divvying up the sprint work as the developers see fit. The position is 100% remote, with the occasional in person all engineering meetings which occur for a few days every year or two. We have typically had new developers on the team spend a sprint working on improving test coverage as it allows them to get into the code and understand the code base.

Interested in this job? Please apply here: https://www.colibrigroup.com/about-us/careers/

items.content:
Affinitiv

Data Engineer

Work from home for a fun, successful, profitable company. Affinitiv is looking for an experienced Data Engineer to work on several large projects. Knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server administration and T-SQL are a must. The applicant must be a fast learner and willing to dive in quickly. Our proprietary software utilizes unique targeting capabilities, capitalizes on our extensive data analytics giving our engineers interesting projects to work on, lots of autonomy to make good coding decisions, and we try to keep meetings to an absolute minimum.  This is a remote (domestic United States only) position, unless you live in the Tampa Bay area. We are only considering senior level candidates who are self-motivated and can be productive without someone standing over their shoulder.  Responsibilities: * Design, develop, and maintain search related functionality in the application * Work on a team dedicated to the ongoing core needs of the software platform * Work with engineers on other teams when necessary to fix SQL performance related issues * Assist the Database Administrator in various administrative tasks and act as backup when necessary  Required Skills and Experience: * 8-10+ yearsâ experience as a software developer and/or SQL administrator. * Extensive hands-on experience with Microsoft SQL Server / T-SQL, as well as experience with C# and the .Net Framework. * Able to troubleshoot performance bottlenecks for SQL queries and read query execution plans. * Good understanding of the following: types of indexes and when to use them, transaction isolation levels and windows analytical functions. * Knowledge of administration tasks with SQL Server like backups, log backups, checkdb and index/statistics maintenance. * Knowledge of high-availability cluster setup is preferred. * Experience with AWS, Elasticsearch, and streaming solutions would be beneficial in this role. * Prefer experience with Redis. * Preferred experience with Scrum/Agile as well as test-driven development and various automated testing frameworks. * Experience with .Net Core preferred. * Leadership experience is helpful, but not required.  Job Benefits & Perks: * Paid health, dental, and vision insurance. * 401K, paid holidays, and PTO. * Competitive wage; compensation commensurate with skills and experience.

World Wide Technology

Software Engineer

World Wide Technology, Inc. has opportunities for enthusiastic Software Engineers to join our highly collaborative remote working community. # Responsibilities Our remote workers work alongside others throughout the day utilizing a variety of online collaboration tools for communication, code collaboration and screen sharing. Candidates will be responsible for the analysis of business, engineering, and scientific problems, and the documentation and development of well-defined methods, procedures, and programs in the delivery of practical systems solutions. This includes detailed software design, developing code with unit tests to implement the design, correcting flaws based on requirements testing, and integrating the applications.Â¬Â¬ # Requirements The following knowledge skills and attributes are required: â¢ A minimum of 5 years of professional software development experience in C#.NET &/or JavaScript. â¢ Experience with web enabled application development and client and/or server development. â¢ Proven development experience using SQL. â¢ Experience with the automated build process, unit testing, source code analysis tools â¢ Experience under formal software development processes. â¢ Experience with multiple platform environments, including UNIX/Linux and Windows Server (any version) â¢ Proven ability to produce quality documents using a variety of media, text and tools with a minimum of errors. â¢ Critical thinker with the ability to demystify complex technical requirements. â¢ 10% Travel: While the role will be fully remote (5-days a week), there will be a requirement for occasional travel to either WWT offices or client sites. â¢ Candidates would be expected to work from home or other remote work environment. â¢ You will be responsible for ensuring that you have a work space that is suitable and appropriate for a full day of collaborative work. Sufficient space for you to work, including space for a computer, monitor and video conferencing equipment. â¢ High Speed Internet access with sufficient speed/bandwidth to enable frequent video calls. The equipment will be provided for you and the cost of high-speed internet will be subsidized. â¢ Be willing to work on a variety of project types (Desktop, Web, Mobile) and programming languages (JavaScript, C#, Java, Kotlin, Swift, Erlang, Python, etc.) as needed. The following knowledge skills and attributes are preferred: â¢ BS in Computer Science or equivalent experience. â¢ Proven development experience using a modern front end framework such as: React.js, ReactNative, Angular 1/2 â¢ Experience with Service Oriented Architecture technologies and/or implementations. â¢ Excellent personal presence with proven ability to work with all levels of management internally and externally. â¢ Highly motivated and dependable with exceptional communication. â¢ A self-starter that relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish individual and team goals. Additional Requirements: â¢ Possesses a high level of Integrity. Acts ethically and is above reproach. Builds trust through their honesty, reliability, and authenticity. Possesses a strong concern for the needs of his/her colleagues. Takes tough principled stands even if they are unpopular. Meets commitments and keeps promises. â¢ Demonstrates Self-control. Manages his/her impulsive feelings and distressing emotions and operates without any personal agenda. Stays composed, positive and unflappable even in trying moments. Thinks clearly and stays composed and focused under pressure. â¢ Must be Flexible. Smoothly handles multiple demands, shifting priorities and rapid change. Is able to work collaboratively to get things done. Proactively seeks the advice and suggestions of peers, subordinates, and superiors. Adapts strategies and tactics to fit fluid circumstances. Is flexible in how he/she sees events. â¢ Is Optimistic. Demonstrates a positive mental attitude. Persists in seeking goals despite obstacles and setbacks. Operates from a hope of success rather than a fear of failure. Sees setbacks as due to manageable circumstances rather than a personal flaw. â¢ Continuously Develops Others. Committed to the continuous process of education and development of self and colleagues. Acknowledges peopleâs strengths and accomplishments. Offers useful feedback and helps to identify othersâ needs for future growth and improvement. Mentors and gives timely coaching that fosters an individualâs skills. â¢ Able to Intuitively Understand the way people think and work. Understands the forces that shape views and actions of clients, customers, or competitors. Accurately reads an organizational and external reality. â¢ Models Leadership qualities. Articulates and arouses enthusiasm for a shared vision and mission. Leads by example. â¢ Is a catalyst for Change. Recognizes the need for change and removes barriers. Challenges the status quo to acknowledge the need for change. Champions the change and enlists others in its pursuit. â¢ Fosters Excellence in Communication. Is effective in give-and-take, registering emotional cues in attuning their message. Deals with difficult issues straightforwardly. Listens well; seeks mutual understanding and welcomes the sharing of information fully. Fosters open communication and stays receptive to bad news as well as good. items.content:
Office 365/EMS/Win10 Architect/Consultant - Migrations/Deployments - 100% remote!

Experis is currently supporting our client, a global technology company with their search for a very technical person. I'm looking for a professional who has 5-10 years of experience as a solution architect with hands-on experience doing Office 365/Win7 to Win10 migrations and deployments and moving clients to the cloud. This contract position is slated to last an initial 18 months and is 100% fully remote! If you have the technical background I need, have great people skills and have worked in global technology companies in a similar capacity, get in touch.

What is it you'll have to do?

The Architect will help enterprise customers find the most efficient way to transition to the cloud, deal with technical and business blockers to onboarding and to drive adoption. This role is about ensuring a seamless Office 365 onboarding for clients.

- Engage with clients to ensure the onboarding experience is focused on standard, outcome-oriented activities
- Help clients and partners in deploying onboarding plans that level the Microsoft 365 service features
- Define necessary deployment requirements, capture and approve customer success plans to transition clients to O365 and maintain high-level of customer satisfaction
- Engage with both internal/external stakeholders to ensure that the customer is ready to transition to O365 at the time of license purchase by addressing business blockers that could impact the rapid onboarding and adoption of O365
- Act as the SME on Microsoft 365 deployment and usage in key readiness events
- Collect/process product improvement concepts in order to accelerate future customer adoption of cloud services

Your specific background:

  • Background as a solution architect/consultant
  • You are a consultant/architect with 8+ years of experience (as a Microsoft Partner or service provider)
  • Very good knowledge of: Active Directory, Exchange On-Premise, ADFS

Expert knowledge in either:

1) Messaging and Identity:

  • O365 workloads: Identity, EXO, Teams (mandatory)
  • Identity and messaging with multiple forests
  • Experience with complex O365 projects is mandatory

2) EMS and Win10

  • EMS workloads: AADP, AIP, Intune
  • Win10 deployments
  • Experience with very complex EMS projects is mandatory
  • ENGLISH only, perfectly fluent. Any other language skills are highly desired
  • All relevant Microsoft certifications
  • Good knowledge of pre-sales processes: SOWs, etc.
  • Office 365 cloud experience (Windows deployments/Office ProPlus/Exchange/Sharepoint)
  • Strong customer-facing skills: you need to be a great communicator because you will be dealing with clients at C-level

If you are immediately available for this exciting project in Zurich, Switzerland, please get in touch directly with Eric Schuster or send him your CV and testimonials today. We can only consider Swiss/EU nationals for this engagement.

Autodesk Construction | Windows Engineer | NYC, Portland, SF or Remote (US & Canada) | Full-time

Autodesk Construction Solutions is on a mission to build the future faster by creating beautiful software for construction, one of the oldest, largest, and least digitized industries on the planet. Our tools are used by everyone on a construction site, from workers in hard hats to project engineers in the office. We make a big impact in these peoplesâ work lives by helping them deliver projects faster and more cost-effectively.

We are looking for a Windows Engineer to join our Markups and Collaboration team. This team is responsible for one of the core features of our application: marking up blueprints and 3D building models. Customers use markups to collaborate at all stages of construction, from pre-construction reviews to documenting a project for hand over to an owner. Our team works across all of our client applications (Android, iOS, web and Windows) to build a seamless, world-class markup tool. tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=26, c=4, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=4}
items.content:
As a Software Engineer at Hire Space you are responsible for an infrastructure used by millions of people.


You'll be working across the full stack, predominantly on the back end of our core app at hirespace.com. This includes multiple sets of APIs and MVC projects. You'll be exposed to a variety of technologies and will have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop new skills.


The role also involves contributing to the team through code review, participation in retrospectives and contributing to architecture planning.

Must have skills:


  • 4 years of experience of building apps using ASP.NET and C#

  • Passionate about software engineering with an awareness of various technologies across the stack

  • Understanding of the importance of building reliable, well-tested systems

  • Experience working in a professional software development team



Nice to have skills:


  • Experience of agile with Jira and Git

  • Front end experience using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML

  • Knowledge of Azure and Elastic Search

  • Dev Ops experience with Team City and Octopus

  • Computer Science degree, or equivalent



Benefits:
Not only do we offer a competitive salary but we also believe in offering the following benefits:


  • Generous EMI share option scheme

  • Pension plan

  • Team Socials & Team Lunches

  • Regular "lunch and learns"

  • Regular professional development opportunities

  • Free nights out in London's coolest venues

  • Office pool table

  • Friday night beers


 


About Hire Space

As the UK’s leading venue booking platform, Hire Space is disrupting the events industry through transformational technology. We’ve built something that is used by over a million event bookers each year and we’re just getting started.

We work with over 10,000 clients including The Guardian, Facebook, Time Out, BuzzFeed and Sky who rely on our expertise and technology to help organise their events. We also work closely with a community of over 6,000 venues in the UK to help our clients book venues through our platform. We are increasingly working overseas too - from New York to Berlin and Singapore.

Through EventLAB we’ve created a platform for event organisers to learn, develop, get connected, and discover what’s new in the world of events. This is achieved through our flagship event every October, our regular Series events and the EventLAB Podcast.

We’re a growing team of ambitious, talented and passionate individuals who enjoy working in an exciting and collaborative environment that encourages innovation and contribution from everyone. We're also technical innovators who solve problems and release innovative products that will change the events industry. Our strong culture is also important to us and we work relentlessly to make sure that Hire Space is a fantastic place to work.

 

Ultimately, we're here to make event booking a joy

Remote | Freelance

Project Duration: an estimated 240 hours from November 2019 through February 2020

Who You Are:

Required Qualifications:

  • Proficiency in Windows OS and MS Office software, especially Word and Excel.

  • Satisfactory completion of industry related background checks.

Location: This is a telecommute project that can be done from anywhere in the US. The selected candidate must have access to a suitable PC workstation and reliable internet access.

Doctype | Software engineer with reverse engineering skills / Anti-cheat engineer | Stockholm, Sweden | ONSITE, VISA or REMOTE (worldwide) | Full-time | https://www.doctype.se/

We're a small digital agency based in Stockholm, Sweden. Currently around 15 people. We have an office in the heart of Stockholm, but our employees are free to work from wherever they feel most productive. We've built https://lemondogs.com/, https://www.gothiaecup.com/, https://beta.esportal.se/, amongst other websites. Our largest clients are within the eSports segment.

Weâre currently looking for a software engineer with reverse engineering skills to work with us on client-sided anti-cheat technology. Our current tech stack is mainly Go, MariaDB and React, but the project you would be working on is a standalone client built in C/C++, Go and Assembly.

Requirements:

* Good understanding of C and x86-64 assembly

* Good understanding of the x86 architecture

* Good understanding of the Windows NT kernel

* Good grasp of reverse engineering

* Eager to learn

Nice to have:

* Experience with reverse engineering malware/cheats/games, the windows NT kernel

* Experience with binary instrumentation

* Experience with hardware-assisted virtualization (such as VT-x and AMD-V), SLAT (Second Level Address Translation) (e.g. EPT, NPT)

* Understanding cryptography primitives

The role weâre looking to fill is full-time. Youâll be working together with another anti-cheat engineer to combat cheaters in video games. We can offer relocation to Sweden and assist with housing.Feel free to mail me at asamy@doctype.se if this sounds interesting to you!

We are a tight knit team focused on results, and are seeking an entry-level software developer who wants to grow and learn â¦ but, honestly, if you want to catch our attention, we are looking for people who are not afraid to jump in the trenches and join our team which does hard things exceptionally well and has fun while doing it!

items.content:
Impero Software


Lead Software Engineer

At Impero, we've been in Education Technology since 2002, building systems to keep children and young people safe and make them successful. We are passionate about protecting every learner, their wellbeing and their future through managing, supporting and monitoring. We do this by working closely with educators around the world. With recent new leadership, we're building a distributed UK-based engineering team to reimagine our technology platform. We are first and foremost looking for best of breed developers who are positive and ambitious and who can demonstrate strong engineering principles. Whether youâve been developing for two years or ten we may have a role for you. Our product vision is exciting and the roadmap ahead is challenging. Our team is growing in a way that will allow you to play to your strengths: whether enjoying data modelling and analysis, or building huge new feature sets. We believe in creating careers, not jobs. During your time with us youâll receive regular, honest, helpful feedback, with a clear progression path. Weâll be looking for ways to grow your expertise, and we will provide opportunities for your professional development. Weâre a distributed team, who put energy into speaking every day, and we arrange regular meetings both by department and as a company. In the first few months as you get to know the team and products, we'll bring you into our Nottingham office as needed, but our team is distributed-first: doing your best work isn't dependent on you being in a certain place. Our web platform - less than two years old - is built exclusively in Ruby on Rails with interlinking native device clients, communicating through standard web protocols. At Impero, we believe we're creating something special, and we'd love for you to join us. Lead Software Engineer (Windows) Role The successful candidate will take responsibility for working as a software engineer within an agile team to develop the companyâs Windows device client applications, and will lead the Devices team. Responsibilities Leadership * Act as team lead to the team of device software engineers, working across Chrome OS, macOS, iOS and Android platforms. Operational * Work within a cross-functional software team (consisting of Software Engineers, Cloud Infrastructure Engineers and testers) to develop device clients for Windows devices. * Take responsibility for the quality and speed of your own deliverables. * Perform automated and manual testing on your own work. * Assist other members of the engineering team where required. Characteristics Essential * Experience of working in a distributed workforce in an agile development team. * At least 3 years of commercial experience (or equivalent) in .NET Core (C#) development for Windows. * At least 3 years of experience in writing automated tests. * Understanding of Android OS APIs. * Experience of integrating device applications with web applications. * Understanding of programming, networking and information security principles. * Enthusiasm for understanding technical ideas and explaining them clearly to other members of the team. * A strong standard of spoken and written English.

items.content:
DESCRIPTION


Who we are


AppyWay is on a mission to helping cities thrive, from the kerb up. We understand how fragmented infrastructures and stand-alone solutions cause stress and hassle for the most mundane of daily tasks, like finding and paying for a parking space. We know there’s a better way of doing things and so we’re building innovative and future-ready solutions from the bottom up, to improve the way parking is accessed and managed.


Our holistic kerbside management platform provides a ‘future of mobility’ conduit between the private and public sector, ensuring standardised kerbside data can flow between local authorities and mobility operators, unlocking the barriers that hinder the adoption of intelligent mobility solutions and ultimately make the kerb work for everyone, physically, socially and commercially.


AppyWay is backed by a number of leading investors including Hyundai Motors and Sumitomo Corporation, and recently closed a significant £7.6 million Series A funding round.


We’ve won several prestigious awards over the years including more recently Best Transportation-as-a-Service Project Award from the TaaS Technology Conference as well as being ranked as a top 50 disruptive UK company in the 2019 Disruption 50 Index.


We’re building something big, from the ground up, so this is a great chance to get on board with that and make a mark on a company that you can call your own.




REQUIREMENTS


So what is a developer in AppyWay? A team player? Autonomous? A rock-star? A self-starter? Yes (but all JDs say that right?). But you are also adaptable, dependable, sociable. At your heart you are a passionate problem solver, an engineer. You like “sleeves rolled up headphones on don’t talk to me I’m in the zone ok i’m done where’s the pub” you are that kind of animal. You know that sometimes it’s a one-person problem and sometimes it’s a team one - you’ll play different roles at different times.


Generally:



  • Strong experience of C# .Net development

  • Developing RESTful APIs and integrating with external services

  • Experience working on large scale problems

  • Advocate of automated regression testing

  • Passion to do things the right way

  • Experience with agile methodologies and automated delivery

  • Can contribute to technical and business discussions to help shape products and roadmaps

  • Experience with geo-spatial data is a plus


More specifically:


The below is not a shopping list - but the kind of tech we use. The more you have the better it is, but the willingness to pick this stuff up (and potentially make alternative suggestions) is what we are after.



  • C# .Net, Azure, REST

  • JS / Html / Css

  • ElasticSearch, Git CLI

  • Rabbit MQ,

  • AzureServiceBus

  • Angular JS (1.6+) Or Aurelia

  • Data Ingestion & transformation

  • DDD, CQ(R)S, Event Driven Architecture

  • Message queues, MassTransit, AzureServiceBus

  • GIS, GeoJson experience

  • Microservices, SOA

  • TimeSeries Data processing

  • Regular Expressions




BENEFITS


AppyWay works hard to create an inclusive environment to be a part of. A culturally diverse workspace, but all sharing the same eye-on-the-prize mentality - but on top of that:



  • Generous Salary - £40,000-£50,000 DOE

  • Pension - we all get old. look at the CTO - we didn't know numbers went up that high!

  • Perkbox - free stuff/cheap stuff/discounted stuff - what's not to like?

  • Ability to work from home - it's where the heart is.

  • A very cool office in Farringdon - exposed brick, glass, sofas, sideboards (like the 70's)

  • Share options - If AppyWay does well, so do we all!

  • Biscuits, lots of biscuits - (and fruit) but who doesn't like the odd biscuit.


By submitting your details you agree to our Candidate Privacy Policy that can be found on the following link: (https://appyway.com/candidate-privacy-policy/).

items.content: At Impero, we've been in Education Technology since 2002, building systems to keep children and young people safe and make them successful. We are passionate about protecting every learner, their wellbeing and their future through managing, supporting and monitoring. We do this by working closely with educators around the world. With recent new leadership, we're building a distributed UK-based engineering team to reimagine our technology platform. We are first and foremost looking for best of breed developers who are positive and ambitious and who can demonstrate strong engineering principles. Whether youâve been developing for two years or ten we may have a role for you. Our product vision is exciting and the roadmap ahead is challenging. Our team is growing in a way that will allow you to play to your strengths: whether enjoying data modelling and analysis, or building huge new feature sets. We believe in creating careers, not jobs. During your time with us youâll receive regular, honest, helpful feedback, with a clear progression path. Weâll be looking for ways to grow your expertise, and we will provide opportunities for your professional development. Weâre a distributed team, who put energy into speaking every day, and we arrange regular meetings both by department and as a company. In the first few months as you get to know the team and products, we'll bring you into our Nottingham office as needed, but our team is distributed-first: doing your best work isn't dependent on you being in a certain place. Our web platform - less than two years old - is built exclusively in Ruby on Rails with interlinking native device clients, communicating through standard web protocols. At Impero, we believe we're creating something special, and we'd love for you to join us.Lead Software Engineer (Windows)RoleThe successful candidate will take responsibility for working as a software engineer within an agile team to develop the companyâs Windows device client applications, and will lead the Devices team.Responsibilities Leadership* Act as team lead to the team of device software engineers, working across Chrome OS, macOS, iOS and Android platforms.Operational* Work within a cross-functional software team (consisting of Software Engineers, Cloud Infrastructure Engineers and testers) to develop device clients for Windows devices.* Take responsibility for the quality and speed of your own deliverables.* Perform automated and manual testing on your own work.* Assist other members of the engineering team where required.CharacteristicsEssential* Experience of working in a distributed workforce in an agile development team.* At least 3 years of commercial experience (or equivalent) in .NET Core (C#) development for Windows.* At least 3 years of experience in writing automated tests.* Understanding of Android OS APIs.* Experience of integrating device applications with web applications.* Understanding of programming, networking and information security principles.* Enthusiasm for understanding technical ideas and explaining them clearly to other members of the team.* A strong standard of spoken and written English.

items.title: Remote Malware Reverse Engineer Lead
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=1, dotnet=43, c=24, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=8, frontend=0}
items.content:
Location: Charlotte, NC
Description:

Note: Potentially remote for candidates that possess all of the required skills


We are seeking an experienced Malware Analyst/Reverse Engineer to perform malware analysis and reverse engineering in support of incident response, investigative analysis, threat hunting, and research on existing and emerging cyber threats. The role will involve in-depth analysis of static and behavioral analysis of complex malicious code utilizing various tools, including disassemblers, debuggers, hex editors, un-packers, virtual machines, and network sniffers. The candidate will perform the functions of malware analyst/reverse engineer and serve as a liaison for Threat Services for the Global Fusion Center, and mentor and collaborate with the threat hunting, incident handling/response, and forensics teams.


Key Responsibilities

  • Use expertise in malware analysis/reverse engineering to evaluate and analyze complex malicious code.
  • Perform reverse-engineering for suspected or known malware files, determining the TTPs associated with the code.
  • Develop custom tools designed to automate analysis.
  • Perform research around malicious software, vulnerabilities, and exploitation tactics, and recommend preventative or defensive actions.
  • Produce detailed reports identifying attributes and functionality of malware, and IOCs that can be used for malware identification/detection, to include behavior, identified infrastructure used for command and control, and mitigation techniques.
  • Assist in identifying (hunting) and profiling threat actors and TTPs.
  • Develop host and network based signatures to identify specific malware via heuristic and/or anomaly based detection methods.
  • Participate in formal technical briefing and proposals.
  • Perform as an Information Security SME in the several of the following areas:
  • Malicius code behavior
  • Threat Intelligence
  • Incident Respnse
  • Web Applicatin
  • Lg analysis (statistical modeling, correlation, pattern recognition, etc.Microsoft platform (Server, workstation, applications)
  • Key Responsibilities (Cont'd)
  • Open Systems platfrms (Linux, UNIX, VM Ware ESX)
  • Netwrking (firewalls, IDS/IPS, packet capture)
  • Databases (Oracle, SQL Server, DB2, IMS)


  • Providing mentorship and support to teammates regarding malicious file analysis/behavior, communication/rapport with other divisions and various levels of leadership, technical expertise, and career development.
  • Capable of identifying need & driving solutions, and providing guidance, in an autonomous manner.


Job Qualifications

  • Bachelors and/or Masters Degree in Engineering, Computers Science, or related field
  • 7+ years overall technical experience in either reverse engineering/malware analysis, threat intelligence, incident response, security operations, or related information security field.
  • 5+ years experience in application design/engineering, including but not limited to programming/scripting, Windows/Linux system administration, RDBMS/NoSQL database administration, etc.
  • 2+ years experience in penetration testing or ethical hacking
  • 2+ years experience with reverse engineering tools like IDA Pro, Ghidra, OllyDbg, Windbg, and Wireshark.
  • 2+ years experience of Python scripting to automate analysis and reverse engineering tasks (and Bash or Powershell or PerlC/C++).
  • 2+ years experience of x86, ARM, and x64 architectures.
  • Ability to reverse engineer binaries of various types including: x86, x64, C, C++, and .NET.
  • Strong understanding of Windows Operating System Internals, Windows APIs, and writing and analyzing DLLs.
  • Recent experience developing custom software and hardware tools to assist in performing reverse engineering and vulnerability analysis.
  • Strong understanding of common network and application stack protocols, including but not limited to TCP/IP, SMTP, DNS, TLS, XML, HTTP, etc.


Experience with security operations tools, including but not limited to:

  • SIEM (e.g. Splunk, ArcSight)
  • Indicatr management (e.g. ThreatConnect)
  • Link/relatinship analysis (e.g. Maltego, IBM i2 Analyst Notebook)
  • Signature develpment/management (e.g. Snort rules, Yara rules)


Contact:

This job and many more are available through The Judge Group. Find us on the web at
- provided by Dice

items.content:
Outpatient Facility Coding Specialist at Aviacode

Remote

Job Locations: US-Virtual/Remote

Job ID: 2019-1845

# of Openings: 4

Category: Medical Coding

Minimum Hours: Varies

Overview

Remote Outpatient Facility Medical Coding Specialist Full-Time

Now Hiring! Are you a credentialed professional coding specialist looking for a new stable work environment? We are recruiting now for OP facility coders working FT -40 hours per week employee status from the comfort of your own home office. Aviacode is nationally recognized as one of the top medical coding companies in KLAS and Black Book Market Research surveys. Whether you are wanting more work-life balance or just wanting to fall in love with your job again, connect with us today to learn more about our inspiring career opportunities. Must have AHIMA credentials and full time availability.

Responsibilities

This position will be responsible for medical coding for one of our larger facility clients. Coder will be responsible for reviewing charts, coding appropriate charges and ensuring high quality standards are achieved. Coders required to have three to five years years outpatient experience in a facility setting with 95% or higher quality reviews consistently coding: OP, Same Day Surgery, Observations and Emergency Department. Consistently work a set schedule Monday though Friday, 40 hours per week between the hours of 6 am â 6:30 pm PST

Qualifications

  • CCS, RHIA, or RHIT required
  • Minimum three to five years years inpatient or outpatient coding experience in facility setting
  • Maintain standard industry productivity rates of Same Day Surgery (6 charts/hour) and Observations (3 charts/hour) and Emergency (12 charts/hour)
  • Demonstrated ability to maintain high quality standards of 95% or greater
  • Proficient in utilizing technology (computer, VPN, MS Office, coding software) to perform responsibilities
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Must have ICD-10 coding experience
  • Experience with trauma and highly complex cases, coding and/or charge verification or drug administration preferred
  • Must have PC with Windows 10 Professional OS with dual monitors. (No MAC pcâs)
  • High speed Internet required

Must pass candidate assessment test with a minimum score of 85%. This position is a full-time virtual/work from home position.

Aviacode provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identification, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Aviacode complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Aviacode expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on protected classes. Improper interference with the ability of Aviacodeâs employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

By automating time-intensive, manual processes and operational workflows and delivering powerful, consolidated analytics, real time dashboards and reporting from across your security infrastructure, Swimlane maximizes the incident response capabilities of over-burdened and understaffed security operations.Swimlane was founded to deliver innovative and practical security solutions to organizations struggling with alert fatigue, vendor proliferation and chronic staffing shortages. Swimlane is at the forefront of the growing market for security automation and orchestration solutions that automate and organize security processes in repeatable ways to get the most out of available resources and accelerate incident response.We are focused on tangible work products, not micro management, we support our employees in the personal and professional goals. This role will allow you to work on cutting edge technology and have an unprecedented impact on the future of an enterprise solution.

items.content:
Title: Dot net Developer

Duration: 12+months Contract (100% Remote)

Location : Maryland Heights-MO

  • Description:
  • Looking for a Software Engineer with 5-8+ years of .NET development experience.
  • Any database and Angular knowledge a big plus. AWS and Devops experience a large plus as well.
  • Experience working in an Agile environment is a big plus.
  • Develop guidelines for other software engineers that helps them build and implement code that is scalable, stable and secure.
  • Be a hands-on software engineer who can write quality code, assist with problem solving, root cause analysis, trouble shooting and coaching.
  • Understand big picture from a business standpoint within the context of the application.
  • Write technical blogs and be active in Open Source Community.
  • Agile, DevOPS and Cloud:
  • Apply Design Thinking techniques on application design.
  • Lead agile software development efforts as a Technical Leader.
  • Coach other software engineers on practices such as TDD, ATDD and pair programming.
  • Understand advanced concepts of Containers, Micro-Services, Continuous Delivery and Continuous integration, and guide the team to setup a DevOps environment for the applications they build and support.
  • Review and take actions based on application metrics, including but not limited to code quality, business metrics and performance metrics.

Requirement Needs:

  • Looking for a Software Engineer with 5-8+ years of .NET & C# development experience.
  • Experience in AngularJS, HTML, CSS & Front end Development required
  • Strong SQL Experience required
  • Any database and Angular knowledge a big plus. AWS and Devops experience a large plus as well. Experience working in an Agile environment is a big plus.
  • This is a REMOTE position, so you will have the ability to work from home from anywhere in the US.

items.content:
InfoTech Resources is assisting our client in their search for a lead Identity and Access Management (IAM) Architect. This position could be full-time or contract and allows for remote work. The role will be to provide expertise and design services for Microsoft Active Directory, ADFS, PKI, SSO and Identity Federation for the enterprise. Work closely with IT and business partners to ensure identity and access solutions meet or exceed security policies and regulatory compliance requirements. This role will provide technical leadership, subject matter expertise and direction on complex projects/initiatives for their assigned area(s) of responsibility. Will provide subject matter expertise and direction on complex projects/initiatives for their assigned area(s) of responsibility.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead research, design, architecture, implementation and security of Active Directory (SSO/AD FS, WFS, DNS, DHCP) and PKI infrastructure for the enterprise
  • Design, implement, secure, manage IAM solutions, policies, roles, identity federation for multi-tier apps on prem, cloud hosted, and SAS applications
  • Work closely with IT and business partners to ensure identity and access solutions meet or exceed security policies and regulatory compliance requirements
  • Work with various application, infrastructure, and security engineering teams to ensure proper IAM controls
  • Responsible for design / integration of Active Directory services with AWS / AZURE
  • Leads design, implementation, support and integration of Active Directory services in support of Office 365 / Sharepoint / OneDrive / Sailpoint / AWS
  • Leads research, design, architecture and implementation of the enterprise cloud services supporting related Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS), Software as a Service (SaaS) and managed platforms (PaaS).
  • Provides direction and guidance for design, architecture, implementation and security of business-critical infrastructure platforms that host LFG applications and platforms
  • Development of infrastructure automation (IaC) utilizing Puppet Enterprise, Chef, Ansible, PowerShell etc.
  • Coordinates and leads projects through all phases of design and implementation within areas of responsibility

Experience:

  • 5 - 7 years IT work experience in an enterprise information technology infrastructure environment with emphasis in Active Directory technology and ADFS (required)
  • Expert level knowledge of Active Directory including SSO / Identity Federation Services architecture and LDAP (SSO/ADFS, WFS, DNS, DHCP, RBAC, SAML + PKI) (required)
  • Expert level knowledge of authentication / authorization principles: OAuth, SAML, Kerberos, MFA, Cognito, S
  • Broad understanding of core Microsoft cloud technologies and services, including Azure IaaS and Office 365, and core Microsoft technologies, including Active Directory, ADFS, Exchange, SharePoint, Windows Server, OneDrive
  • Extensive experience working with AWS and AZURE / O365 (AWS Certified Architect Preferred)
  • Proven track record operating in a lead technical role and managing large enterprise multi-domain Active Directory environments: AD Services, Replication, Performance, Troubleshooting, Monitoring, Disaster Recovery, Security and Administration
  • Proven track record operating in a lead IAM role designing / deploying complex solutions utilizing Microsoft Active Directory Federated Services (ADFS)
  • Fundamental networking knowledge - IP, DHCP, DNS, WINS, routing, etc
  • Knowledge of federated identity technologies
  • Experience with web server technology IIS, Apache/PHP, Tomcat
  • Proven experience with Windows Server 2008 (R2), Windows Server 2012(R2), Windows Server 2016
  • Experience with Private Cloud and Hybrid cloud configurations, patterns, and security practices/patterns in Azure; scripting and automation technologies; PowerShell; and experience leading enterprise deployments.
  • Proven self-starter who takes ownership of opportunities, works independently, manages multiple / simultaneous projects, and deals well with ambiguity and last-minute changes
  • Experience deploying virtual infrastructure using cloud services
  • Experience delivering projects via Agile methodologies
  • Working knowledge of concepts such as CI/CD, source control, application publishing, etc.
  • Strong executive presence including communication and presentation skills with a high degree of comfort to large and small audiences.
  • Proficiency in IAM principles, with experience in cloud computing, cloud security, security assurance
  • Proven track record of delivering highly secure enterprise solutions
  • Strong knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle
  • Extensive experience in system design/architecture that directly aligns with the specific responsibilities for this position

Education

  • 4 Year/Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience (4 years of experience in lieu of Bachelor's) in Information Technology or related field (Minimum Required)
  • MCP, MCSA, MCSE (preferred)
  • AWS Certified Solution Architect - Associate (preferred)
  • Puppet Certified Professional (preferred)
- provided by Dice

items.content:
FocusIT, Inc. is a technology provider specializing in Software as a Solution (SaaS) products for the mortgage and financial services industries. The Company has enjoyed continuous growth since being founded in 2002 and has built a team of employees throughout the United States, all working virtually from home offices. The Company is revamping its team and hiring a Lead Developer to help take the Company to the next level.

Responsibilities of the Lead Developer
Reporting to the Product Manager, the Lead Developer will be responsible for providing leadership to a team of Developers and driving projects to successful and timely completion.

Since FocusIT, Inc. is based in Scottsdale, AZ, it is preferred that candidates are local in order to be available for quarterly in-person meetings.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Managing, growing and leading a small team of Developers Guiding collaboration to design effective, efficient and secure applications Proactively identifying areas of risk in project deliverables Defining, measuring and enforcing the Company s software development methodology
Requirements of the Lead DeveloperBachelor s degree in information technology, computer science or related field 5-10 years of professional software development experience required Proficiency in .net and SQL required Experience leading Agile Development teams Strong understanding on DEV structure and building systems with a consistent framework Experience in AWS, Azure and MVC preferred, but not required Ability to read and speak fluent Spanish strongly preferred, but not required
Compensation and Benefits Package for the Lead Developer This is a full-time, remote, and permanent position with competitive starting salary, benefits package, paid time off, and a strong company culture. Employees work remotely from home and receive a monthly home office reimbursement.

The Recruiting Process for the Lead Developer
The recruiting process is designed to ensure that we make the right hire for this critical position and will include a combination of phone and web-based interviews, candidate assessments, and a pre-employment background check.

The Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer!

JavaScript, C#, .NET

Senior .NET Developer/Architect
95% remote

If you are a Senior .NET Developer/Architect and interested in working primarily remote, please read on!

Based in Nisswa, we are a fast growing cloud based self storage management software and payment processing company. We currently have about 60 employees and scaling up our development team.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- Work primarily remote (ideally come in the office 1-2 times/month)
- Competitive salary
- Strong PTO package
- Dynamic and exciting work environment
- Stable yet growing organization w/ great track record of growth and strong tenure and employee retention
- Excellent health and medical benefits for individuals and families
- Opportunity to work both independently and part of a larger team with various levels of responsibilities

What You Will Be Doing

- Provide full life cycle support for code changes in the production environment and development of new extensions to existing platform
- Collaborates with System Architect to ensure that design meets system architectural objectives
- Maintain a high proficiency level with system architectures and database system models
- Help us build and scale our dynamic software platform

What You Need for this Position

10 - 15+ years with a focus in C#/.NET and experience with the following:

- ASP.NET
- JavaScript / Angular
- BS in CS (or related) is preferredSo, if you are a Senior .NET Developer (95% remote) with experience, please apply today!

Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.

items.content:
Formstack

 

Junior Software Developer

Formstack, the most flexible and powerful form building application, now has many products! We are looking for a Junior Software Developer to add to the  team! Formstack is a 13-year-old company with its roots in Indianapolis. Our customers span 110 different countries, and our employees live and work across the U.S. and the globe. We provide a work environment that is flexible and provides great freedom for those who can perform. We are seeking people who demonstrate an ability to work effectively with individuals from diverse cultures and backgrounds. Who You Are: You are someone who works in the best interests of our customers. We are a customer focused company and every team member advocates and takes responsibility for our customers. You have passion and energy because you love what you do - you bring enthusiasm to the work and to your team members every single day. Your strong technical background, hands-on ability and analytical mindset makes you proud. You spend a significant amount of time learning on and off the job....we take learning seriously. Most importantly you are interested in becoming a the best Software Developer and willing to work hard at it. What You Will Do: The Junior Software Developer will work as part of a highly cohesive and multi-functional team to deliver new product features, fix defects and usability issues and take ownership of our automated testing. How You Will Succeed: * Take part in Sprint planning to break down user stories into technical tasks and implement new features in ASP.Net and Salesforce technologies (Apex, VisualForce, Lightening). * Investigate and fix defects in all parts of our software stack (C#/.Net, Azure/PaaS, Salesforce/Apex/VisualForce, Front-end web-JQuery, Javascript) * Assist in writing C# Selenium Tests using the NUnit Framework * Take ownership of our automated testing and ensuring we have a high level of coverage with consistent 100% pass rate. * Investigate and fix database performance issues * Run regression tests and verifying results * Perform manual functional tests for new features/bug fixes * Undergo code reviews for all deliverables * Understand the Basics of Salesforce and Formstack Salesforce App in order to effectively create new features for our product What We Are Looking For: * Understanding of basic OOP principles and knowledge of PHP language * Basic understanding of MySQL or other relational database * Basic understanding of Git or other version control system * Basic understanding of Scrum and Agile methodologies * Basic understanding of unit tests and business-driven development * Ability to work remotely and with remote team members  * Excellent oral and written English skills * Ability and passion to work with more experienced team members * Passion for software development  * Excellent customer service skills  What Formstack Offers: * 100% covered Medical Insurance, as well as company-paid Dental, Vision, Disability and Life Insurance Benefits for full-time employees. * Unlimited PTO for all employees * 401k with matching company contribution for full-time employees * The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software and other tools needed to excel at your job * Company-paid conferences and extended learning * Yearly company gatherings Want to learn more about who we are and what we value? CLICK HERE to hear from some current Formstackers about what matters most! Formstack is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce. All data collected in our application process from resume collection to application questions is used for recruitment purposes only. We will store it in our applicant tracking system, JazzHR, and will not share this data with anyone else. We will keep your data until the role is filled and only continue to store it if we feel you may fit future roles. Thank you for your interest in Formstack!

Knowledge of C# .NET Framework 4.6/4.5/4.0/3.5/2.0 BCL. Knowledge of ASP.NET MVC5, Identity, and WCF. Knowledge of HTML5, JavaScript, CSS2/3, and JQuery. Knowledge of source control systems such as Team Foundation Server (TFS). Experience writing Unit Tests using MSTest or equivalent unit testing framework. Proficient in Windows operating system, distributed systems, and basics of the Citrix environment. Knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server Business Intelligence Studio (SSIS, SSRS). Knowledge of ASP.NET Web API Knowledge of Unit of Work, Repository, Model View Controller/Presenter. Proficient with Azure DevOps. On September 10, 2018, Microsoft renamed Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS) to . With Azure DevOps Server 2019, Microsoft is renaming Visual Studio Team Foundation Server to Azure DevOps Server. 1.VSTS Azure DevOps Services 2. TFS - Azure DevOps Server - provided by Dice

items.title: Salesforce Software Developer-remote consdered
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=1, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Company Information
Solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. That's Travelers. Our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers - and opportunities for our employees. You will find Travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Job Summary
Travelers is looking for energetic, creative and talented people to join our Sales Enablement technology team, powered by the Salesforce platform. You will be responsible for the design, development, testing and implementation of all components of our Salesforce implementations. You will work with a team of talented engineers and contributors from across the company to enable effective and scalable solutions that will be leveraged by thousands of Travelers personnel. Working within an agile delivery model, this team will have a profound effect on driving efficiencies, increasing revenue and enabling a strategic technical foundation for the future. You will work with Salesforce capabilities including Lightning, Financial Services Cloud, and expansion into our growing portfolio of Salesforce Cloud technologies.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
  • Develop, implement and maintain standard configuration and customizations using APEX, VisualForce, Lightning Components and JavaScript
  • Integrate Salesforce platform with source applications using defined integration patterns to ensure production readiness and an outstanding user experience
  • Participate in agile delivery activities such as design, estimating, retrospectives and continuous improvement
  • Create and execute test scripts for assigned development work
  • Ensure availability of the Salesforce platform and provide on-call support to resolve application issues when necessary
  • This position is open for candidates to work remotely.

Minimum Qualifications
A bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, or its equivalent in work experience, and five years of programming/development experience.

Education, Work Experience & Knowledge
  • 3 years or more as a Salesforce Developer (APEX, VisualForce, Lightning) is required
  • Experience in Salesforce CRM integration, developing and deploying custom integration solutions using APIs and API management systems is desirable
  • Proficiency with Data tools (SQL Server, SQL, ETL, Dataloader, etc.) is desirable
  • Experience working as a team member in an Agile delivery model
  • Working knowledge of test automation tools like Selenium
  • Working knowledge of CA Agile Manager (Rally) or similar ALM tools
  • Working knowledge of automated deployment/DevOps tools and technologies
  • Working knowledge of source control management tools such as Git

Job Specific & Technical Skills & Competencies
Technical Knowledge: Able to expertly assess, design develop, and support applications, systems and solutions to achieve business and/or technical requirements. Demonstrates technical expertise for multiple languages, applications, systems, technologies, and/or frameworks, and has the ability to influence technical direction or defect resolution. Fully understands business applications and/or technical system environments in which the system operates.
Communication Skills: Ability to communicate thoughts/designs/ideas in an unambiguous manner and adjusts communication based on audience. Exhibits active and effective communication skills with team members - including active listening and effective written and verbal communication skills. Effectively contributes and communicates with the immediate team. Able to present complex technical concepts to audiences of varying size and level.
Business Knowledge & Partnership: Able to develop business partnerships and influence business priorities through solution identification aligned with business objectives and goals. Able to communicate in business terms and describe IT capabilities and concepts in ways that the business can understand.
Problem Solving & Decision Making: Able to proficiently diagnose root causes and solve complex problems. Able to evaluate alternative solutions and assess risk before taking action. Has the ability to reach sound decisions quickly and escalates appropriately. Demonstrates ability to optimize the use of all available resources.
Team Orientation: Able to maintain and enhance partnerships across the organization to achieve objectives. Practices objectivity and openness to others' views. Able to recognize and support team priorities.
Leadership: Accountable to set technical goals and priorities for self and other team members. Exhibits team leadership and collaborates with partners.
Planning and Project Management: Demonstrates ability to identify critical project tasks and establish clear priorities while keeping the bigger picture in mind. Able to effectively collaborate with Project Manager and utilize sound project management practices. Able to manage time and competing priorities.
Financial Awareness: Able to assess the financial impact of recommended designs/solutions.

Environmental/Work Schedules/Other
  • This position is open for candidates to work remotely.
  • Requires occasional weekend and/or overnight work hours.
  • Requires periods (1 or more weeks) of travel as needed.
  • Requires travel up to 5% of the time.

Physical Requirements
Operates standard office equipment. Requires extended periods of computer use. Requires extended periods of sitting.

Licensing or Certificates
  • Salesforce.com certifications such as Certified Platform Developer I, Certified Platform Developer II are strongly preferred
  • Remain current with Salesforce technologies and best practices, including Salesforce certifications as appropriate

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Travelers is an equal opportunity employer.
To apply for this position please CLICK HERE

items.title: Worthy Peer Capital: Senior Python Backend Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=6, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Senior Python Backend Developer


Who we are

We are Worthy - and so are you! We want to democratize capital by making money more accessible for those who need to borrow it and by making investments with strong returns available to those who would like a better financial future.

We want to help people grow a nest egg even if they think they canâtâ¦ and to do it while supporting Main Street, not Wall Street!

Our first product is a free micro-investment app that helps you save & grow your money â a dollar at a time. It monitors your everyday spending and rounds up each transaction to a whole dollar. It then automatically invests every $10 into a 5% interest earning Worthy Bond, which in turn supports small creditworthy businesses across the U.S., helping to strengthen our local communities.

We are a remote-first company with offices in sunny Boca Raton, Florida. We avoid the noise of Slack, but we use Twist, Keybase and Confluence to keep in sync. We're on Gitlab to take advantage of their integrated CI/CD pipeline (we love continuous stuff!) and issue tracker.


Who you are

Youâre an experienced backend web developer who has worked for 5+ years on a few production web apps and APIs at scale. Experience working on financial or accounting applications preferred.

You use Python on a daily basis for various tasks, from APIs to scheduled tasks and maintenance scripts.

You can design and implement an API and future-proof it. You have a strong opinion on whether APIs should be versioned in the URI or in a response header, and can defend that opinion. You know how to upgrade an API while keeping it backwards-compatible for older clients.

Youâre aware of which data fits best in a relational database and which in a document-oriented one. You can use a framework-provided ORM, but can also jump in and fine-tune SQL queries when needed. You know enough database management to create and maintain an efficient schema in PostgreSQL, indexes and all.

Youâre experienced enough to avoid most bugs and programming errors, but you use tools such as linters and write unit & integration tests to catch all the others.

You can secure both internal and public-facing APIs using different methods, including one-time passwords (TOTP) for two-factor authentication. You consider security and privacy when designing any new features or reviewing existing code.

Most importantly, you can communicate clearly and efficiently in writing, as well as in online video/audio calls. You can handle the async (over)communication requirements of a remote-first environment and can manage your own time and productivity.

For everyoneâs sake, you develop on either OS X or a Linux flavor. We donât do windows.

You are eligible to legally work in the U.S. as a full-time employee. Given the role's responsibilities, this is a hard requirement, even though we will have other positions where we can hire more liberally. Note that this doesn't require actual presence in the U.S. (expats welcome!).


What youâll do

Weâve build a solid, stable serverless API using Zappa on AWS Lambda. Our infrastructure is mostly managed via Terraform and our deployments are one-click, thanks to Gitlabâs CI/CD pipelines. While we rely on third parties for some key features, weâve never had any downtime caused by anything we wrote.

Concretely, youâll help build new business features as we grow our offerings. You will help us trim our backlog and keep technical debt in check. Since we already have robust test coverage, you will help maintain that by writing unit and integration tests for all new features and any bugs fixed.

You will also perform light devOps duties via Terraform and (rarely) manually, such as Gitlab instance upgrades or bastion security checks and updates. Youâll participate in planning & prioritization meetings to help estimate complexity and think of creative solutions to business and growth problems.

You are required to have at least basic experience with our existing stack, but more importantly, you need to have the ability and desire to learn and adapt.


What youâll get

  • you can work remote from anywhere in the U.S. or from our office in Boca Raton, FL
  • youâll set your own work schedule, as long as you can deliver and be productive (we prefer two 3-hour focused, uninterrupted work sessions, with morning, lunch and evening communication breaks to stay in sync)
  • competitive salary for a remote position
  • health insurance & stock options
  • more benefits as we continue growing

How to apply

We donât do resumes. They only prove who signed your previous paychecks.

Send us your Git(hub/lab/bucket) profile, places where we can "see" your backend code in production, along with a short email explaining what kinds of problems you solved in the past, and how you did it.

In essence, please convince us weâre a good fit for each other with any arguments youâd like.

Weâll contact you by phone or email for a quick chat, then weâll set up a video call with the CEO and CTO.

There will be no gimmicky interview quizzes or whiteboard tests. Instead, weâll ask you to show us some code, either from a previous job or, if NDAs prevent that, weâll write some together. This is not to test you under pressure, but to filter out the inevitable applicants who are trying to fake it till they make it.

Weâll ask you to try out something new and talk us through it, whether itâs a new framework, concept (GraphQL instead of REST?) or an AWS service neither of us used before. We do this to see if youâre willing and able to learn new things and how you handle bumping into small obstacles on the way to delivering something that works, however trivial.

items.content:
Omniware

Full Stack Software Developer

Immediate Need: We are looking for a mid-level Software Developer experienced in Angular 5 +, C#, ASP.Net Core, Web API, Visual Studio, and Entity Framework. We are seeking a motivated individual capable of managing their time and tasks. This position is essentially 100% remote, however some in-person team meetings will be required; therefore someone located within around 30 miles of the Garner/Raleigh, NC area is highly preferred. Hours: 4 Core hours are required between the days and hours: Monday - Friday 9am-3pm EDT with a call-in stand-up at 11am. The rest of your hours can be flexed. Benefits: Medical, 401K matching, Dental, Vision, STD, LTD, Earned Paid time off, Flex schedule, REMOTE See additional details below: PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (Essential Job Functions) * Work with a remote team of software developers, testers, and domain experts to design and develop data-intensive, web-based applications using Angular, Microsoft .NET framework and SQL Server. * Perform software development activities including requirements gathering and analysis, systems design, development, documentation, testing and integration, and publishing. Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: * Minimum B.S. in computer science, engineering, or a related field and professional experience with an emphasis on full lifecycle systems development including system design, development, and maintenance/support. * Years of software development experience required: minimum of 5 years of recent hands-on software development experience. Preferred 7-10 years of recent experience. * Strong demonstrated experience in web development using Angular, C#, and .Net Core. * Experience working with relational databases (Microsoft SQL Server 2008 - 2016) and developing database-driven .NET applications. * Experience using ASP.NET UI controls, HTML5, JSON â Including ASP.NET core, Angular material. Desired Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: * Hands-on experience using agile software development methodologies and practices such as Test Driven Design (TDD). * Experience using Object Role Models (ORM) such as the Entity Framework / LINQ to SQL. * Experience with Distributed Source Control tools such as Git and non-distributed like TFS. * Familiar with Design Patterns (implementation and explanation). * Ability to manipulate and analyze data. * Strong communication skills and the ability to work well in a team environment.
